creator.organizationName: University of Rostock, Biolological Station Zingst, Mühlenstraße 27, D 18374 Zingst

metadataProvider.organizationName: University of Rostock, Biolological Station Zingst, Mühlenstraße 27, D 18374 Zingst

section.para: Data set contains abiotic parameters of the Zingster Strom water column (upper 50 cm). This part of the site Darß-Zingst Bodden is situated between the innermost waterbodies and exhibits average salinity and nutrients. Data are sampled daily at 8:00. Data are given as monthly medians. The data of 2011 and 2012 are contributed to the EnvEurope project (action 5).

keywordSet.keyword: Completely mixed water column with reduced salinity

section.title: Dataset access and use constraints
section.para: Principal:EnvEurope (LTER-Europe) has granted a permission of type:Free for access and use upon request
The data provider must be offered co-authorship for publications using this dataset at least within the metadata description
Formal acknowledgement of the dataset providers
The opportunity to collaborate on the project using the dataset
The opportunity to review the results based on the dataset
Reprints of articles using the dataset must be provided to the data provider

contact.organizationName: University of Rostock, Biolological Station Zingst, Mühlenstraße 27, D 18374 Zingst

para.literalLayout: The given site contains some of the used methods as laboratory instructions to be downloaded as pdf. They were written for students paractical courses. The language of this material is German (only, so far). A station methods manual is under construction. Language will be English. Note, that nutrients are measured in a continuous flow analyser, not manually. Some methods are still missing (plankton microscopy). Some methods changed recently or will be modified soon. Any user has to ask for the exact information for a specific method and time range.

methodStep.instrumentation: salinity: WTW Cond 1970iwater temperature: mercury thermometerSecchi diskturbidity: Xion 500 photmeter, 5 cm cell lengthpH: Hach-Lange IntelliCell, HQ30doxygen: Hach-Lange LDO optode, HQ30d

section.para: Water is sampled with a Rutner sampler from the upper 50 cm of the water column daily at 08:00 CET. Oxygen saturation is measured in a Karlsruher bottle within 5 min in the lab. Salinity, turbidity and pH are measured in 15-20°C warm samples. The sampling spot represents a very small spot of the area. However, the Zingster Strom is subject to in- and outflows of the neigbouring bodden basins. This brings a high variability of day-to-day data, but may expand the areal coverage/representation.
